Barbarian.description: Either by choice or by circumstance, Barbarians have chosen to spend their lives in the harsh wilderness. Oftentimes, Barbarians prey upon innocent travelers, taking slaves or possessions. Known for their uncouth nature.
Barbarian.standings: Barbarians are the enemies of law keepers.

Ranger.description: Rangers are the vigilante law keepers of the wilds. They take it upon themselves to police roads, countrysides, and entire regions to keep travelers safe. They are naturally disliked by lawless individuals.
Ranger.standings: Barbarians are the enemies of law keepers.

Hedge Knight.description: A self proclaimed knight, hedge knight's move from region to region, seeking to find employment where they can. Hedge knights are supposed to live by a code of honor, but on the road these things tend to fall apart.
Hedge Knight.standings: Hedge Knights are not fond of Knights

Knight.description: The genuine article, knights have sworn their lives to king and country.
Knight.standings: Knights are loved by kingsmen, and distrusted by hedge knights and rangers. Knights are duty bound to fight the lawless.

Battle Mage.description: Balanced between physical and magical attacks, battle mages have trained to be highly versatile fighters.
Battle Mage.standings: Battle mages sometimes get along poorly with clerics.

Mage.description: A student of magic, mages are highly intelligent and are adept spellcasters.

Wizard.description: Often eccentric, wizards are known to be wayfarers and meddlers. Most keep to themselves, approaching others only to entwine them in schemes only they know about. Wizards arrive precisely when they mean to.
Wizard.standings: Wizards are known to be friends to all races, and get along particularly well with Halflings and Rangers.

Cleric.description: After pledging their allegiance to their deity, Clerics have made it their duty to follow their will. To do this, Clerics use miracles from the book of healing help their deity impose its will on the world.
Cleric.standings: Clerics are friends to all those who fight for good, and get along especially well with Holy Knights, Paladins, and members of their church.

Thief.description: For one reason or another, thieves have turned to a life of crime. Their crimes, however, are nonviolent when possible; the rich don't need all that gold, anyway.
Thief.standings: Thieves hat law keepers and Thief Catchers

Thief-Catcher.description: It takes a thief to catch a thief. Thief-Catchers are thieves turned straight, who now hunt down their old comrades.
Thief-Catcher.standings: Thief Catchers hate thieves, and are distrusted by lawkeepers

Lordling.description: A child of noble parentage, the lordling was born with a silver spoon in his mouth. Now, he is going out into the world to find adventure.
Lordling.standings: Lordlings are respected by kingsmen, but are often set upon by thieves.

Lady Fair.description: Delicate and noble, the Lady Fair is a beacon of love and hope for their people. While used to living in the safety of her castle, she isn't afraid to go out into the wilds, as long as the wilds have warm beds and three square meals.
Lady Fair.standings: Of noble birth, your character is loved by their people, but is prone to attacks by thieves and brigands.

Bard.description: Showmen by nature, Bards are known for their skills at performing music, juggling, and distracting others from the sorrows of life.
Bard.standings: Bards are loved by most, and are welcomed equally among thieves and goodfolk.

Marksman.description: Excellent archers, Marksmen come from all walks of life.
Marksman.standings: Excellent archers, Marksmen come from all walks of life.

Huntsman.description: Skilled archers, huntsmen prefer the woods to towns, and spend most of their time tracking game.
Huntsman.standings: Huntsman are generally disliked by knights and the highborn.

Monk.description: Masters of hand to hand combat, monks use their extensive self-knowledge to overcome their foes.
Monk.standings: Monks keep to themselves, which cause some outside of their religion to attempt to take advantage of them.

Beastmaster.description: For the Beastmaster 'Animal Person' is an understatement. Most Beastmasters have forgone civilization, choosing instead to roam the wilds, capturing and befriending animals.
Beastmaster.standings: More comfortable in nature than cities, Beastmasters get on best with animals, and can find people difficult to talk to.

Gunslinger-Sharpshooter.description: Through luck, valor, or perhaps trickery, the Gunslinger has managed to acquire one of the rarest weapons in the world. As such, they have a close bond with their weapon, which is usually their primary means of income.
Gunslinger-Sharpshooter.standings: More comfortable in nature than cities, Beastmasters get on best with animals, and can find people difficult to talk to.

Necromancer.description: Death is not my enemy, nor is it my ally, it is my servant. So say the Necromancers, mages who study the intricacies of the hereafter. Often fuled by macabre fasination or a god complex, Necromancy is deeply feared and considered taboo by almost all.
Necromancer.standings: Necromancers are feared by most, and are actively hunted by Clerics and followers of the light.

Paladin.description: Soldiers of the Light, Paladins are knights who have pledged themselves do a deity. As such, Paladins are capable of performing minor miracles from the book of healing.
Paladin.standings: Paladins are generally respected. They hate evil, and try to destroy it wherever they find it.
